decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings / document title number(s): LOCATION PLAN; PROPOSED BLOCK PLAN DATED 13/04/2024; SUMMER HOUSE ELEVATIONS RECEIVED 17/06/2024; FENCE ELEVATIONS RECEIVED 17/06/2024; PHOTOGRAPH OF SHED (BARTON + 3' VERANDA); PHOTOGRAPH OF FENCE (HORIZONTAL LATTICE TOP)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The detached outbuilding hereby approved, as well as the garden plot, shall be used only for domestic purposes incidental to 4 Blakesley Court and shall not be used for any separate independent use.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the land in accordance with Policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), Policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
subdivision_of_building: No buildings affected: private garden adjoining the block of flats
description: Construction of an outbuilding and replacement of garden fence
